docs.lead_paragraph: David B. Caruso, a national investigative reporter with wide experience in government accountability and data journalism over nearly 15 years with The Associated Press, has been named New York City news editor.

headline.main: Investigative Reporter David Caruso Named AP NYC News Editor
headline.print_headline: Investigative Reporter David Caruso Named AP NYC News Editor

docs.snippet: David B. Caruso, a national investigative reporter with wide experience in government accountability and data journalism over nearly 15 years with The Associated Press, has been named New York City news editor.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans failed in their latest futile attempt Tuesday to kill President Barack Obama's health care overhaul, a Groundhog Day vote by the House that was solely an exercise in election-year political messaging.

headline.main: House GOP Fails Anew to Repeal Obama's Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: House GOP Fails Anew to Repeal Obama's Health Care Law

docs.snippet: Republicans failed in their latest futile attempt Tuesday to kill President Barack Obama's health care overhaul, a Groundhog Day vote by the House that was solely an exercise in election-year political messaging.

docs.abstract: The problems of being a realist.
docs.snippet: The problems of being a realist.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Zika virus has hit India's Tata Motors, which has decided to rebrand a soon-to-be launched hatchback vehicle which was to have been called Zica, an abbreviation of "Zippy Car."

headline.main: Zika Virus Forces India's Tata Motors to Change Car's Name
headline.print_headline: Zika Virus Forces India's Tata Motors to Change Car's Name

docs.snippet: The Zika virus has hit India's Tata Motors, which has decided to rebrand a soon-to-be launched hatchback vehicle which was to have been called Zica, an abbreviation of "Zippy Car."

docs.lead_paragraph: Mediclinic International Plc, which is being created by the merger of Al Noor Hospitals Group and Mediclinic International Ltd, will be listed in London on Feb. 15, the chief executive of Al Noor said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Merged Al Noor/Mediclinic to List on Feb. 15, Eyes Gulf Expansion
headline.print_headline: Merged Al Noor/Mediclinic to List on Feb. 15, Eyes Gulf Expansion

docs.snippet: Mediclinic International Plc, which is being created by the merger of Al Noor Hospitals Group and Mediclinic International Ltd, will be listed in London on Feb. 15, the chief executive of Al Noor said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts on the U.S. pharmaceutical market aren’t optimistic that letting the government play drug negotiator would mean lower costs.

headline.main: The Real Reason Medicare Is a Lousy Drug Negotiator: It Can’t Say No
headline.print_headline: Weak Negotiating Position: Medicare Often Can’t Say No

docs.abstract: The Upshot; experts who study American pharmaceutical market counter arguments from presidential candidates, both Republican and Democrat, that prescription drug prices could be cut if federal government directly negotiated with drug manufacturers in pricing Medicare drug plans.
docs.snippet: Experts on the U.S. pharmaceutical market aren’t optimistic that letting the government play drug negotiator would mean lower costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Greg Bird, who shined in 157 at-bats last season, will have a procedure to repair a torn labrum in his right shoulder after initially injuring it last spring.

headline.main: Yankees’ Greg Bird Will Miss Season After Shoulder Surgery
headline.print_headline: Yanks’ Top Prospect at First Base Will Miss Season After Surgery

docs.abstract: New York Yankees first baseman Greg Bird will undergo season-ending shoulder surgery.
docs.snippet: Greg Bird, who shined in 157 at-bats last season, will have a procedure to repair a torn labrum in his right shoulder after initially injuring it last spring.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to articles in Science Times.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to articles in Science Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Travel insurance sales for trips to Latin America have surged as vacationers consider scrapping their plans to avoid the rapidly spreading Zika virus, one of the top U.S. providers, RoamRight, told Reuters on Monday.

headline.main: Exclusive: Travel Insurer Says Sales Soar on Zika Fears
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Travel Insurer Says Sales Soar on Zika Fears

docs.snippet: Travel insurance sales for trips to Latin America have surged as vacationers consider scrapping their plans to avoid the rapidly spreading Zika virus, one of the top U.S. providers, RoamRight, told Reuters on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz was questioned by a meeting attendee, Mike Valde, about his plans to repeal President Obama’s health care law, in Hubbard, Iowa, on Saturday.

headline.main: Cruz Confronted by Voter on Health Care

docs.snippet: The Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz was questioned by a meeting attendee, Mike Valde, about his plans to repeal President Obama’s health care law, in Hubbard, Iowa, on Saturday.
